III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/25/24, Youth A was involved in an incident where he was
sexually assaulted by two other youth at the facility. The two youth
were able to gain access to the youth's room where they threw the
youth on the bed and pulled the youth's underwear down. Staff
were in the room within 10 seconds and stopped the incident from
going further.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone. Complainant
reported no additional information.
Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024.
Administrator 1 reported this incident occurred in the evening of
10/22/2024. She said Youth A reported this to his therapist on
10/23/2024. Administrator 1 said she spoke with Staff 1 and Staff
2, and they denied that Youth A was assaulted. They said Youth
A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were playing around and they
all ran into Youth A’s room when the youths were getting ready to
step down for the night, they followed them and redirected the
youths out of the bedroom. They denied any of the youths got
assaulted or hurt. Administrator 1 reported Youth A was moved to
a different pod. Youth B, and Youth C are still on the same pod,
but Youth D was discharged from the program on 10/25/2024.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024. Youth A
has been at the facility for one year. Youth A is currently on Pod
E, but he was previously placed on Pod A. Youth A reported he
was moved because of an incident with Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D as they came into his room and kicked him, tried to pull
his shorts off, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 came immediately and made
the three youths go to their rooms. He denied he was sexually
assaulted or hurt. He said the incident happened right before
bedtime. He said youths are not allowed to go into other youths’
rooms. Youth A reported he told his therapist about the incident
2

and that’s when he was moved to Pod E. Youth A reported he
feels safe on his current pod.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024. Youth B is
placed on Pod A. Youth B has been at the facility for 6 months.
Youth B reported on 10/22/2024, he was playing around with
Youth A. He denied sexually or physical assaulting Youth A. Youth
B admitted he, Youth C, and Youth D, were playing around with
Youth A when they went to his room, but said they were only in
the bedroom for a few seconds. He mentioned they were getting
ready to step down for bedtime. He said Staff 1 and Staff 2
followed them and made them go back to their rooms. Youth B
said several times that they were all horseplaying and nothing
happened.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024. Youth C
has been at the facility for two months. Youth C is placed on Pod
A. Youth C denied sexually assaulting Youth A and said he does
not want to answer any other questions. Youth C walked out of the
interview room.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 11/22/2024. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for 5 months. Staff 1 recalled the
incident and on 10/22/2024 the youths were getting ready to step
down for the night. She said Youth A was going to his room and
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D ran into Youth A’s bedroom, she
and Staff 2 followed them and redirected out of the bedroom. She
said they complied and went to their rooms for the night. She
denied Youth A was physically or sexually assaulted. She said the
youths were only in the bedroom for a few seconds. Staff 1 said
the youths had been playing around and joking with each other all
evening and therefore an incident report was not completed
because nothing happened. She denied Youth A appeared to be
upset or reported being hurt.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 11/22/2024. Staff 2 has
worked at the facility for 2 months and was working with Staff 1 on
10/22/2024. Staff 2 reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D had been horseplaying with each other. He said the
youths ran into Youth A’s bedroom, he and Staff 1 followed the
youths and directed them to go to their rooms. He denied
witnessing the youths assaulting Youth A or pulling his shorts off.
He said Youth A was fine, and did not report any concerns.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 11/27/2024. Therapist
has been working with Youth A for one year. Therapist reported
3

Youth A told him on 10/23/2024 that Youth B, Youth C, and Youth
D, came into his room, kicked him, and tired to pull his shorts off.
Youth A did not say he was sexually assaulted, but said the
youths tried to pull his shorts off. Youth A did say that staff
members did come immediately and made the three youths go
back to their bedrooms. Therapist said he completed an incident
report and filed a police report.
Youth E and Youth F were interviewed at the facility on
11/27/2024. Youth E and Youth F are placed on Pod A. Youth E
and Youth F both reported they were in their bedrooms and did
not witness Youth A getting assaulted in his bedroom. Youth E
and Youth F both reported feeling safe and expressed no
concerns regarding the facility.
Administrator 2 reported Youth D completed the program and
was discharged from the facility on 10/25/2024. Administrator
provided a contact number for Youth D.
Youth D was contact via telephone on 12/17/2024 and
12/20/2024 and a voicemail was left requesting a call back. A
letter was mailed out to Youth D’s last known address on
12/23/2024 requesting he contact DCWL. As of the date of this
report, return communication has not been received.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 10/23/2024 completed by Therapist
was consistent with therapist interview.
• Youth Supervision policy states proper supervision of youth
is necessary to ensure youth and staff safety and to
prevent escape. Staff are always responsible for the
supervision and ongoing safety and security of youth.
Youth may never be left unattended or unsupervised by
staff. Staff shall maintain within continues line of sight
supervision when they are outside of their rooms. Staff
shall monitor youth closely to assess the need for de-
escalation and/or the agency’s therapeutic crisis
intervention model.
• Staff 1 and Staff 2 personnel files: no disciplinary records.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews with Staff, and
Youths there is insufficient evidence that Staff were not
supervising, and that Youth A was sexually assaulted. Staff were
supervising and when Youths went into Youth A’s room Staff
redirected them to go to their rooms.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A Special Investigation was initiated following an allegation that a youth was sexually assaulted by two other youths in his room at the Lincoln Center facility. The investigation, involving interviews with staff, multiple youths, and the alleged victim, found that while an altercation involving horseplay and an attempt to pull down the youth's shorts did occur, staff intervened within seconds and the evidence was insufficient to substantiate the claims of sexual assault or a lack of supervision. Given the immediate staff intervention and the investigative conclusion, primary culpability for a serious assault was not established, though the incident highlights ongoing behavioral risks within the facility.
